item.title: Small-scale mass estimates for Laplace eigenfunctions on compact $C^{2}$ manifolds with boundary
item.dc:creator: Hans Christianson, John A. Toth

item.title: Spectral Property of Magnetic Quantum Walk on Hypercube
item.description:
arXiv:2412.18401v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we introduce and investigate a model of magnetic quantum walk on a general hypercube. We first construct a set of unitary involutions associated with a magnetic potential $
u$ by using quantum Bernoulli noises. And then, with these unitary involutions as the magnetic shift operators, we define the evolution operator $\mathsf{W}^{(
u)}$ for the model, where $
u$ is the magnetic potential. We examine the point-spectrum and approximate-spectrum of the evolution operator $\mathsf{W}^{(
u)}$ and obtain their representations in terms of the coin operator system of the model. We show that the point-spectrum and approximate-spectrum of $\mathsf{W}^{(
u)}$ are completely independent of the magnetic potential $
u$ although $\mathsf{W}^{(
u)}$ itself is dependent of the magnetic potential $
u$. Our work might suggest that a quantum walk perturbed by a magnetic field can have spectral stability with respect to the magnetic potential.
item.dc:creator: Ce Wang
